recommendations.reason: The provided 'city' value appears to be a state name; the institution name strongly indicates Denver as the city, but explicit evidence is not included in the snippet.
recommendations.evidence: Museum name: 'Denver Firefighters Museum' (no explicit city field confirmation in provided snippet).

raw_response.summary_short: Fire service museum with exhibits, events, and education pages for adults and kids; includes online store, memberships, volunteering, and venue/event hosting.
raw_response.summary_long: The Denver Firefighters Museum presents firefighter history and public-safety themes through exhibits and visitor programming. The site highlights ways to engage beyond galleries—plan-your-visit info, upcoming events, a blog, memberships, volunteering, and dedicated learning sections for adults and kids. It also supports fundraising via donations and retail (online store and an eBay store), and offers event hosting.

collection_highlights.title: Exhibits (firefighting-focused)
collection_highlights.description: Dedicated exhibits section indicates on-site displays centered on firefighting and related history.

collection_highlights.title: Education & learning programs
collection_highlights.description: Separate learning pathways for adults and kids suggest structured educational content and activities.

collection_highlights.title: Public programs and community engagement
collection_highlights.description: Upcoming events, blog, membership, and volunteering options indicate active programming beyond static displays.

visitor_tips: Check the 'Plan Your Visit' section before arrival for visit logistics.
Look at 'Upcoming Events' to align your visit with programs or special activities.
Families should use the dedicated 'For kids!' content for age-appropriate learning.
Consider membership or donating if you want to support the museum’s operations.
raw_response.best_for: Visitors interested in firefighting history, public-safety heritage, and hands-on learning options for adults and kids.
